title: What is "Trances People Live" and how does it explore healing approaches in quantum psychology?
first_phrase: This text explores various theories and perspectives on metaphysics, physics, and psychology. It references a list of significant works such as "Zen Mind, Beginners Mind," "G.I. Gurdjieff The War Against Sleep," and "Trances People Live: Healing Approaches in Quantum Psychology." The themes touched on include mysticism, relativity, and the connection between the mind and the universe. In the last 200 tokens, the author discusses three books by Stephen H. Wolinsky, including "Trances People Live" and "Quantum Consciousness," which delve into quantum psychology and consciousness.
content: Suzuki, Shunru. Zen Mind, Beginners Mind. New York. Weatherhill. 1970. Talbot, Michael. Mysticism and the New Physics. New York: Bantam Books. 1981. Wilson, Colin. G.I. Gurdjieff The War Against Sleep. Aquarian Press, England. 1980. Wittgenstein, Ludwig. Tractatus Logico-Philosophicus. Great Britian. Routledge & Kegan Paul, Ltd. 1961. Wolf, Fred Alan. Taking the quantum Leap: the New Physics for Nonscientists. Harper & Row. 1981. Wolinksy, Stephen H. Trances People Live: Healing Approaches in Quantum Psychology. Connecticut: Bramble Co. 1991. Wolinsky, Stephen H. Quantum Consciousness: The Guide to Experiencing Quantum Psychology. (1993) Wolinsky, Stephen H. The Tao of Chaos. Forthcoming.
last_phrase: Incorporating Quantum Psychology and healing approaches, Trances People Live by Stephen Wolinsky provides a comprehensive guide to understanding and freeing oneself from various trances that manifest as negative patterns and behaviors. This book is a must-read for anyone seeking to achieve a greater level of insight and consciousness.
